title: Business Card Text
content:
Rounded typeface / text. Feeling stumped.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [wtfsample.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725031819/http:/typophile.com/files/wtfsample.jpg) | 5.65 KB |
| [Immacolata-scans.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725031819/http:/typophile.com/files/Immacolata-scans.png) | 4.26 KB |
author: copysource

comments.content: Looking for a little help on this one. Thanks!
The samples are VERY small, but it could be either Avant Garde Gothic or Century Gothic...

Really tiny samples. When I zoomed in a loooot, I could see that it must be [Serif Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725031819/http:/myfonts.us/td-HHJRl8). Count yourself lucky that they used such a distinctive typeface.

I also second [Serif Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725031819/http:/myfonts.us/td-HHJRl8). Mostly judging by the 'R' and the way it has a rounded leg and with the gap where the leg and counter connect.
